abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Rural
            Water Supply and Sanitation Project for Tanzania is to
            ensure access to improved and sustained water and sanitation
            services in rural communities. The project has three main
            components. The first is initiated in three districts and
            gradually expands to about 12 out of Tanzania's 113
            districts. Activities include: support for establishing and
            strengthening the operational capacity (equipment support
            and training) of district water and sanitation teams (DWSTs)
            to prepare district rural water supply and sanitation
            plkans/plans and appraise RWSS sub-projects proposed by
            communities; support for establishing district RWSS funds to
            finance the construction of new RWSS schemes;the
            rehabilitation and expansion of existing systems and
            possibly other water-related small-scale infrastructure
            investments; and assistance to communities in properly
            managing and operating these systems through apprpriate
            hygiene education as well as promoting HIV/AIDS mitigation
            and prevention activities. The second compoent provides
            sectoral conditional grants to about 250 communities to
            improve the water supply and sanitation services. This
            includes the construction or rehabilitation of existing dug
            or drilled wells, boreholes equipped with handpumps or
            powered pumps, spring tapping, piped systems, household
            latrines, and community sanitation facilities. The third
            component supports the institutional strengthening and
            development of a national RWSS program.
